lib.frc1747.motion_profile.generator._1d

Class ProfileGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • lib.frc1747.motion_profile.generator._1d.ProfileGenerator

  • public class ProfileGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains several utility methods to time parameterize profiles
    Author:
    Tiger Huang

    • Method Detail

      • primaryProfileIntegrate

        public static double[][] primaryProfileIntegrate(double[][] profileSegments,
                                                 int index)
        Integrates the differences of the profile segments to get the location at each time instant. Puts it in the correct format for later methods if this is the primary motion profile.
        Parameters:
        profileSegments - a list of distance differences
        The format is [x0, y0, ...; x1, y1, ...; ...]
        index - which column contains the profile data (in the example above, 0->x column, 1->y column)
        Returns:
        a list of locations at each time
        The format is [q0, 0, 0; q1, 0, 0; ...]

      • primaryProfileIntegrate

        public static double[][] primaryProfileIntegrate(double[] profileSegments)
        Integrates the differences of the profile segments to get the location at each time instant. Puts it in the correct format for later methods if this is the primary motion profile.
        Parameters:
        profileSegments - a list of distance differences
        Returns:
        a list of locations at each time
        The format is [q0, 0, 0; q1, 0, 0; ...]

      • secondaryProfileIntegrate

        public static double[] secondaryProfileIntegrate(double[][] profileSegments,
                                                 int index)
        Integrates the differences of the profile segments to get the location at each time instant. Puts it in the correct format for later methods if this is a profile that needs to be synchronized with another profile.
        Parameters:
        profileSegments - a list of distance differences
        The format is [x0, y0, ...; x1, y1, ...; ...]
        index - which column contains the profile data (in the example above, 0->x column, 1->y column)
        Returns:
        a list of locations at each time
        The format is [q0, q1, ...]

      • skidSteerLimitVelocities

        public static void skidSteerLimitVelocities(double[][] profilePoints,
                                            double[][] profileSegments,
                                            double vmax,
                                            double amax,
                                            double wwidth)
        Calculates the maximum acceleration and velocities for each profile point given the profile differences, max linear accelerations and velocities, and robot wheel width. Fills in the (primary) profilePoints array that is passed in.
        Parameters:
        profilePoints - the translation distance at each time instant
        The format is [x0, v0, a0; x1, v1, a1; ...]
        profileSegments - the differences in translation and rotation between each time instant
        The format is [ds0, dtheta0; ds1, dtheta1; ...]
        vmax - the max velocity in a straight line
        amax - the max acceleration in a straight line
        wwidth - the track width of the robot

      • limitVelocities

        public static void limitVelocities(double[][] profilePoints)
        Adjusts the velocities so that the acceleration limits are not violated.
        Parameters:
        profilePoints - - the profile to adjust velocities
        The format is [x0, v0, a0; x1, v1, a1; ...]

      • timesFromPoints

        public static double[] timesFromPoints(double[][] profilePoints)
        Determines the time for each profile waypoint.
        Parameters:
        profilePoints - the profile waypoints
        The format is [x0, v0, a0; x1, v1, a1; ...]
        Returns:
        the time at each profile waypoint as an array

      • profileFromPoints

        public static double[][] profileFromPoints(double[][] profilePoints,
                                           double[] profileTimes,
                                           double dt)
        Creates a time parameterized profile from 1D profile waypoints.
        Parameters:
        profilePoints - the profile waypoints and limits
        The format is [x0, v0, a0; x1, v1, a1; ...]
        profileTimes - the time at each waypoint
        dt - the desired timestep of the time parameterized profile
        Returns:
        a time parameterized profile
        The format is [x0, v0, a0; x1, v1, a1; ...]

      • synchronizedProfileFromProfile

        public static double[][] synchronizedProfileFromProfile(double[][] timePoints,
                                                        double[][] profilePoints,
                                                        double[] profilePoints2,
                                                        double[] profileTimes,
                                                        double dt)
        Creates a profile that is synchronized with an existing profile
        Parameters:
        timePoints - the existing time parameterized profile
        profilePoints - the profile waypoints
        profilePoints2 - the profile waypoints to synchronize with the existing profile waypoints
        profileTimes - the times of the profile waypoints
        dt - the timestep of the time parameterized profile
        Returns:
        the time parameterized second profile
